results.title: Legal Studies: the criminal trial
results.creator_credit: Countrywide Productions and Law Vision Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: This video, presented by Susanna Lobez, is an overview of the Criminal Court and who participates in it, as it currently operates in Australia. Examined is the roles of: The Judge; The Jury; Prosecutor; Instructing solicitor; Defence; Accused person; Witnesses; The Jury room; The Law of Evidence; The Associate; A Civil trial; Sentencing a convicted person. Also discussed is how the law arrived in Australia. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Lease on life
results.creator_credit: Emerson Yorke and Ermerson Yorke Studio
results.brief_description: The story of an average American family and how they plan to avoid unnecessary illness. Shows the forces of prevention in action, the conflict between superstition and fact, and the effective combination of skilled hands and trained minds in medical teamwork, with special reference to anti-tuberculosis measures.

results.title: Learning Walmajarri (PC & MAC)
results.creator_credit: Catholic Education Office of Western Australia
results.brief_description: SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: PC; Multimedia capable Pentium running Windows 95.16 megabytes RAM, (32 megabytes RAM recommended). Monitor 640 x 480 resolution, 16 bit colour (thousands of colours), 8X CD drive or faster. External speakers or headphones. MAC; 68040 (30Mhz) or better (Power PC recommended) running Mac 0S 7.5 or later. Minimum of 8 megabytes FREE application RAM. DO NOT USE VIRTUAL MEMORY. Monitor 640 x 480 resolution, 16 bit colour (thousands of colours). 8X CD drive or faster. Optional external speakers or headphones. Jointly funded by the Catholic Education Office in the Kimberley region and two schools - Kururrungku Catholic Education Centre and John Pujajangka Plyrin Catholic School, ‘Learning Walmajarri’ is the result of digitising elements of the program taught by tribal elders in the Walmajarri-speaking areas around Broome. “The multimedia format of a CD is well suited to the oral tradition, which is the context in which the elders teach their language, using songs and stories to impart vocabulary and syntax”(‘The Australian’ Tuesday June 8 199 pg. 20). Designed to assist in improving literacy amongst Walmajarri speakers, this program uses jigsaws and traditional stories and songs as entertaining instruction, although people who have no previous experience with Walmajarri may be tempted to give it a try.

results.title: Learning through movement
results.brief_description: Dance classes are taught at Sycamore Elementary School, California, as part of the weekly curriculum. The key is “total involvement” - the child puts their whole being into an experience; their body, mind, emotions, imagination and enthusiasm. The theory says that creative movement promotes harmony of the inner person with their body. Shows classes being held over a period of time with groups of children of all ages.

results.title: Learn not to burn
results.creator_credit: John Marsh, Dick Johnson and Tatham-Laird and Kudner
results.brief_description: Shows some common fire hazards around the house, including smoking in bed, the kitchen stove and improper wiring. Illustrates proper emergency escape procedures and shows what to do when one’s clothes catch on fire. Features Dick Van Dyke.

results.title: Lead poisoning: the hidden epidemic
results.brief_description: The film for the first time puts the problem of lead poisoning in young children in its proper perspective with an authentic “case history” of the problems in all its aspects. Through scenes and persons the comments of physicians and laboratory technicians, the film shows why lead poisoning is so often undetected and goes on killing untold numbers of children.

results.title: Laurel & Hardy Utopia
results.brief_description: Utopia is the final feature in the 25 year career of Laurel and Hardy who were known and loved throughout the world - without a doubt, the most the most successful and best loved comedy duo the world has ever known. In Utopia, Stan and Ollie get into yet `another fine mess’ when they inherit a Pacific island and to everyone’s surprise discover Uranium.

results.title: Laura's pregnant!
results.creator_credit: Deane Hutton, Jean Anne DeVoe and Queen Victoria Hospital Foundation
results.brief_description: Laura’s pregnant! follows 16 year old Laura as she discovers she is pregnant and reflects back on how it all happened, the myths her pregnancy refutes and how she and the baby’s father deal with the situation emotionally and the dilemmas they face. The program briefly explores her options of termination, adoption, marriage and single parenting, without revealing which decision she chooses. A teacher’s guide accompanies the video and provides activities around each section of the tape as well as an extensive bibliography. Suitable for lower and middle secondary school students.

results.title: Late at night
results.creator_credit: Michael C. Chorlton, Bruton Film Studios and Nettlefold Studios
results.brief_description: A London reporter investigates an organised crime ring. Stars Barry Morse; Noel Dryden; Daphne Day; Paul Demel; John Rae; Frank Atkinson; Dennis Harkin; Clifford Cobbe; Ben Williams; Claire Smith; Bill Holland; and Beryl Trent. Story and screenplay by Henry C. James; song ‘Late at Night’ by Arthur Young; musical direction by Arthur Young.
